title: Triply Laplacian Scale Mixture Modeling for Seismic Data Noise Suppression
author: Sirui Pan (Jilin University), Zhiyuan Zha (Jilin University), Shigang Wang (Jilin University), Yue Li (Jilin University), Zipei Fan (Jilin University), Gang Yan (Jilin University), Binh T. Nguyen (Vietnam National University), Ce Zhu (University of Electronic Science and Technology of China)
background: This paper focuses on enhancing seismic data quality by effectively suppressing noise from acquired data in seismic exploration, which involves restoring clean seismic signals from noisy observations.
contribution: This paper introduces a triply Laplacian scale mixture approach to improve noise suppression, enhancing estimation accuracy and computational efficiency.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods relied on direct sparsity penalties through soft or hard thresholding, often struggling with non-stationary noise characteristics in seismic data.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work models noise suppression through a probabilistic framework that jointly estimates variances and sparse tensor coefficients from noisy data.

key_innovation: By leveraging a probabilistic model, this approach offers a more robust estimation process that adapts to varying noise conditions, improving overall noise suppression outcomes.
real_world_impact: Enhanced seismic data quality could lead to more accurate geological interpretations in applications like oil extraction and earthquake monitoring, potentially improving decision-making in those fields.
limitations: The paper does not mention specific limitations but does imply challenges in accurately modeling variances in highly variable real-world data.

new_terms.Triply Laplacian scale mixture: **Triply Laplacian scale mixture** refers to a probabilistic framework that combines multiple Laplacian distributions to model sparsity and variance in tensor coefficients for improved noise suppression.

open_sourcing: The source code for the TLSM algorithm is available at: https://github.com/pansirui/TLSM
